alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:12AM EST until January 15 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour and Hazleton, and the White River at Petersburg. .Rainfall of 1.00 to 1.50 inches across southwestern Indiana this past Saturday night will maintain minor flooding on the White River from near Petersburg to the White River. Flooding is expected to continue through next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Hazleton. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Floodwaters cover much low ground in agricultural season. Low lying oil fields...Pottsville Road and possibly a few other low rural roads flood. High water isolates Pottstown, a river cabin community. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1015 PM CST /1115 PM EST/.
